thread.title: WILDOMAR: 170 apartments targeted for 10 acres
thread.title_full: WILDOMAR: 170 apartments targeted for 10 acres - Press Enterprise

author: MICHAEL J. WILLIAMS
title: WILDOMAR: 170 apartments targeted for 10 acres
text:
BY MICHAEL J. WILLIAMS / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 20, 2015 3:36 p.m. WILDOMAR: 170 apartments targeted for 10 acres Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT Wildomar planning commissioners are scheduled to hold a special meeting Wednesday night, Oct. 21, at City Hall. , FILE PHOTO Related article » A proposal for a 170-unit apartment complex targeted for 10 vacant acres on Wildomar’s south side is scheduled for the Planning Commission’s review in a special meeting Wednesday, Oct. 21.
The panel will convene at 6:30 p.m. in Suite 106 at Wildomar City Hall, 23873 Clinton Keith Road.
Commissioners previously reviewed the project, dubbed Villa Siena, in mid-September but postponed action because only three commissioners on the five-seat panel were present.
The commissioners expressed concern about putting so many units on the site, which is on the north side of Prielipp Road between Elizabeth and Jana lanes. Approval would require a general plan amendment and zone change.
The commissioners also observed there are three apartment complexes in the area, which encompasses Inland Valley Medical Center and Oak Creek shopping center.
Ultimate approval rests with the City Council, which would consider the commission’s recommendations in a future hearing.
Contact the writer: 951-368-9690 or michaelwilliams@pe.com
